node.title: Covid-19 update: Eight deaths, 14,494 cases, 896 in hospital
node.description: Eight more people with Covid-19 have died in New Zealand, while the number of new community cases has fallen to 14,494 today.

node.title: Builder's ute stolen from driveway, but she just wants her dog back
node.description: A self-employed builder is desperate to be reunited with her dog, after it was stolen along with her ute and tools from a driveway yesterday in Christchurch.

node.title: Cristiano Ronaldo creates more history with Man Utd hat-trick
node.description: Cristiano Ronaldo can lay claim to yet another major achievement after netting a hat-trick to lead Manchester United to a 3-2 win over Tottenham in the English Premier League.

node.title: Towering tapestries smuggled out of Afghanistan for exhibition
node.description: Tapestries including two that were slashed with knives and bayonets have pride of place at a new exhibition in New Plymouth.

node.title: NFTs: Gimmicky status symbol or tech revolution zeitgeist?
node.description: It's one of the biggest buzz words online these days: NFTs. Are they a gimmicky, expensive status symbol or are they a starting point for a technological revolution? RNZ is here to clear it all up.

node.title: Protest flotilla arrayed outside Russian's Northland estate
node.description: A Ukraine Peace Flotilla has arrived outside the Northland home of Russian oligarch Alexander Abramov to protest.

node.title: "Rock star" reptile breeder murdered; Coroner: "Not a random act"
node.description: Ben Renick was found laying in a pool of blood inside his Missouri snake breeding facility — shot eight times in the back, once at close range.

node.title: No casualties reported after missiles strike near U.S. consulate in Iraq
node.description: It was not immediately clear what the target was.

node.title: France says Putin shows no readiness to end Ukraine war as fighting rages
node.description: Fighting is raging near Kyiv and heavy shelling in other areas threatens new attempts to evacuate trapped civilians.

node.title: Missing man may have been at Tauranga beach
node.description: Police are appealing for information about missing Tauranga man David Holland.

node.title: Heart attack or homicide? Husband poisoned with eye drops
node.description: Lana Clayton says she didn't mean to kill her millionaire husband when she poured a lethal dose of an over-the-counter eye medication into his drinking water.

node.title: Sector cautiously optimistic on CCCFA lending rule changes
node.description: The government's move to ease controversial new lending rules has received tentative support from lenders and budget advisors.

node.title: Kāka chicks boost Abel Tasman population
node.description: A flock of young kāka chicks have fledged in the Abel Tasman, boosting the population of native parrots in the national park.

node.title: Auckland case numbers could be peaking, modeller says
node.description: There are strong signs Auckland is passing its peak for Covid-19 case numbers, a modeller says, but hospitalisations and other regions' cases are not there yet.

node.title: Two stabbed in New York City museum
node.description: Police are still searching for the suspect, who is a former member of the museum.

node.title: Rise in abusive calls forces food bank to take action
node.description: A Christchurch food bank has had to install a new phone system to record calls after an increase in abuse from clients.

node.title: Chiefs win heavyweight clash
node.description: The Chiefs have shocked the defending champion Crusaders in Super Rugby Pacific with a stunning come-from-behind victory in Christchurch.

node.title: Tauranga city commissioners retained until July 2024, minister says
node.description: Tauranga is not getting its council back, with Minister for Local Government Nanaia Mahuta leaving commissioners in place for at least another two years.

node.title: Autism researchers' early screening tool is world's most effective - study
node.description: Australian researchers have developed a tool that more than halves the average age of an autism diagnosis in children.

node.title: Olympic medalist from Ukraine joins fight against Russia
node.description: "We don't have proper military preparation trainings and fighting experience, but anyway, we are on our land, we are at home and we are ready to protect," Stanislav Horuna said.

node.title: Book excerpt: "I Was Better Last Night" by Harvey Fierstein
node.description: In his new memoir the Tony-winning actor and playwright recalls his film roles in "Mrs. Doubtfire" opposite Robin Williams, and "Death to Smoochy" with Edward Norton and Jon Stewart.

node.title: How Russia is recruiting mercenaries to fight in Ukraine
node.description: Mercenary sources have told the BBC that recruits are being trained at a base in Mol'kino in southern Russia, next to a Russian army base.

node.title: Covid-19 death toll: 'People are losing years of a potential healthy life'
node.description: The number of people with Covid-19 who have died in New Zealand has now reached 105, with 14 deaths reported in the past two days.

node.title: Three die in separate road-related incidents
node.description: Two people have died in crashes in Manawatū and Nelson early this morning and a pedestrian died after being struck by a vehicle in Bay of Plenty last night.

node.title: Covid-19 update: Seven further deaths, 18,699 new community cases
node.description: The total number of deaths of people with Covid-19 in New Zealand has risen to more than 100 with seven more reported today, while community case numbers have risen by 18,699.

node.title: Section of SH1 closed after serious crash in Waikato
node.description: Emergency services are responding to a serious crash on State Highway 1 near Tirau.

node.title: Hailey Bieber reveals she had a blood clot to her brain
node.description: The model said she has since "recovered completely" and is at home.

node.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy defiant as Russian forces regroup near Kyiv
node.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy says Ukraine is at a "strategic turning point" in the war as Russian forces bombard cities across the country and appear to be regrouping for a possible assault on Kyiv.

node.title: Singer Traci Braxton of "Braxton Family Values" dies at 50
node.description: Traci Braxton had been fighting esophageal cancer, according to reports.

node.title: Black Ukraine refugees allege discrimination while trying to escape Russian invasion
node.description: The humanitarian crisis in Ukraine has put a spotlight on alleged racism.
